ygData.subject: Re: IRL - Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Heck, I m just glad y all can play the game.  Everquest is written in English, and I m sure that makes it a pain in the rear for non-English speaking
ygData.messageBody:
At 02:54 PM 8/24/99 +0200, you wrote:
>From: Janko Slaten'sek <janko@...>
>
>
>Well it's me again. I'm sorry if my appology about my english is bothering
>you but I said that because I mean it. The fact is that I got a few mails
>about my language and they weren't very pleasent to read. If you think my
>english is good enough then I can say just one thing. Thanks god at least
>one. Beleive me this is the first mail in which my english is mentioned as
>something good. So I'll never write that appology about my language again.
>I hope I didn't iritate you to much, If I did then I'm sorry I just wanted
>to help.

Heck, I'm just glad y'all can play the game. Everquest is written in
English, and I'm sure that makes it a pain in the rear for non-English
speaking players to understand quests and such. I've seen numerous sites
in other languages, so I know there are lots of 'foreign' players (It's the
internet, how can we be foreigners?). I myself have been accused of being
British on more than one occasion, which, personally, I find quite
humourous. ;)
Anyway, keep on trucking, and if you understood this missive, yer probably
more than qualified to post here. Bad grammar and all.

Did I mention that Bards rule?
;)
Talies the Wanderer
<The Wandering Minstrels>
Bristlebane

P.S. Where *are* you from, you english-as-a-second-language types?
Enquiring (read: "Nosy") minds want to know! ;)
